poem:
Title: In Shadows of Power

Behind labour's throne, a spectre whispers,
Gray by name, power's concealed seamstress.
Compact sold, faster than a songbird's notes,
In the silent auction of power, carried by votes.
Beyond the facade, in the secret assembly,
Vested interests, veiled in humility.
Quietly shaping, beneath politics' fray,
Unseen hand, threading the day.
